summary: The paper describes the construction of plasmids for evolving aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase specificity, involving multiple PCR and ligation steps.
key_claims: Plasmid pREP(1) was constructed in two steps using various PCR fragments and restriction enzymes.

_refs.title: Plasmid pREP/YC-JYCUA (Fig. 2A) was constructed by ligation of a 6.6-kbp SacII-AfeI fragment of pREP(10) and a 3.7kbp calf intestinal alkaline phosphatase (CIP; New England Biolabs)-treated fragment of pYC-J17 (ref. 7), digested first with EarI, followed by blunting with Klenow fragment (New England Biolabs), followed by digestion with SacII. The desired pREP/YC-JYCUA construct was identified by transformation of the ligation reaction into cells containing plasmid pBK-JYRS (ref. 7) and screening for fluorescence on LB agar plates

REP#4R5: 5'-ATTACCGTGCACAATACCATTAACATTGCTAAGAACTAGTTCTCTGAC-ATCGAA-3' REP#3eR: 5'-GAAGTGAAAGCTAAGTAGGGCAAGCGC-3' REP#3eF: 5'-GCGCTTGCCCTACTTAGCTTTCACTTC-3' REP#3dR: 5'-TCCTGTAGGAAATCAAGCCGGAAGCC-3' REP#3dF: 5'-GGCTTCCGGCTTGATTTCCTACAGGA-3' REP#3cR: 5'-ATCCGTGACCTTGAATAGAAGCACTT-3' REP#3cF: 5'-GAAGTGCTTCTATTCAAGGTCACGGAT-3' REP#3bR: 5'-GAGGAATAGCTCAACAAGCGCGTAGGG-3' REP#3bF: 5'-CCCTACGCGCTTGTTGAGCTATTCCTC-3

_title: An efficient system for the evolution of aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase specificity
